meanings.definition: Relating to or composed of dolerite.
meanings.sent1: The doleritic rocks in the area are dark and dense.
meanings.sent2: The geologist identified the doleritic formation based on its composition.
meanings.sent3: The doleritic boulder looked like a giant piece of charcoal.
meanings.sent4: The doleritic cliffs stood tall and imposing against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The doleritic nature of the stone made it difficult to break.

meanings.definition: Resembling dolerite in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The new building had a doleritic facade that matched the surrounding structures.
meanings.sent2: The artist used paint to create a doleritic effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The doleritic pattern on the fabric reminded her of a starry night sky.
meanings.sent4: The doleritic sculpture seemed to blend into the natural landscape seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The doleritic tiles added a touch of elegance to the room.
